name: APT33
descr: [APT33](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0064) is a suspected Iranian threat group that has carried out operations since at least 2013. The group has targeted organizations across multiple industries in the United States, Saudi Arabia, and South Korea, with a particular interest in the aviation and energy sectors.(Citation: FireEye APT33 Sept 2017)(Citation: FireEye APT33 Webinar Sept 2017)

subtechniques.name: Web Protocols
subtechniques.descr: [APT33](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0064) has used HTTP for command and control.(Citation: Symantec Elfin Mar 2019)

subtechniques.name: Archive via Utility
subtechniques.descr: [APT33](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0064) has used WinRAR to compress data prior to exfil.(Citation: Symantec Elfin Mar 2019)

subtechniques.name: Registry Run Keys / Startup Folder
subtechniques.descr: [APT33](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0064) has deployed a tool known as [DarkComet](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0334) to the Startup folder of a victim, and used Registry run keys to gain persistence.(Citation: Symantec Elfin Mar 2019)(Citation: Microsoft Holmium June 2020)

subtechniques.name: Password Spraying
subtechniques.descr: [APT33](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0064) has used password spraying to gain access to target systems.(Citation: FireEye APT33 Guardrail)(Citation: Microsoft Holmium June 2020)

subtechniques.name: PowerShell
subtechniques.descr: [APT33](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0064) has utilized PowerShell to download files from the C2 server and run various scripts. (Citation: Symantec Elfin Mar 2019)(Citation: Microsoft Holmium June 2020)

subtechniques.name: Visual Basic
subtechniques.descr: [APT33](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0064) has used VBScript to initiate the delivery of payloads.(Citation: Microsoft Holmium June 2020)

technique_table_data.name: Credentials from Password Stores

subtechniques.name: Credentials from Web Browsers
subtechniques.descr: [APT33](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0064) has used a variety of publicly available tools like [LaZagne](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0349) to gather credentials.(Citation: Symantec Elfin Mar 2019)(Citation: FireEye APT33 Guardrail)

technique_table_data.descr: [APT33](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0064) has used a variety of publicly available tools like [LaZagne](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0349) to gather credentials.(Citation: Symantec Elfin Mar 2019)(Citation: FireEye APT33 Guardrail)

subtechniques.name: Standard Encoding
subtechniques.descr: [APT33](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0064) has used base64 to encode command and control traffic.(Citation: FireEye APT33 Guardrail)

subtechniques.name: Symmetric Cryptography
subtechniques.descr: [APT33](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0064) has used AES for encryption of command and control traffic.(Citation: FireEye APT33 Guardrail)

subtechniques.name: Windows Management Instrumentation Event Subscription
subtechniques.descr: [APT33](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0064) has attempted to use WMI event subscriptions to establish persistence on compromised hosts.(Citation: Microsoft Holmium June 2020)

subtechniques.name: Exfiltration Over Unencrypted Non-C2 Protocol
subtechniques.descr: [APT33](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0064) has used FTP to exfiltrate files (separately from the C2 channel).(Citation: Symantec Elfin Mar 2019)

technique_table_data.name: Exploitation for Client Execution
technique_table_data.descr: [APT33](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0064) has attempted to exploit a known vulnerability in WinRAR (CVE-2018-20250), and attempted to gain remote code execution via a security bypass vulnerability (CVE-2017-11774).(Citation: Symantec Elfin Mar 2019)(Citation: Microsoft Holmium June 2020)

technique_table_data.name: Exploitation for Privilege Escalation
technique_table_data.descr: [APT33](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0064) has used a publicly available exploit for CVE-2017-0213 to escalate privileges on a local system.(Citation: FireEye APT33 Guardrail)

technique_table_data.name: Ingress Tool Transfer
technique_table_data.descr: [APT33](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0064) has downloaded additional files and programs from its C2 server.(Citation: Symantec Elfin Mar 2019)(Citation: Microsoft Holmium June 2020)

technique_table_data.name: Network Sniffing
technique_table_data.descr: [APT33](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0064) has used SniffPass to collect credentials by sniffing network traffic.(Citation: Symantec Elfin Mar 2019)

technique_table_data.name: Non-Standard Port
technique_table_data.descr: [APT33](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0064) has used HTTP over TCP ports 808 and 880 for command and control.(Citation: Symantec Elfin Mar 2019)

subtechniques.name: Encrypted/Encoded File
subtechniques.descr: [APT33](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0064) has used base64 to encode payloads.(Citation: FireEye APT33 Guardrail)

subtechniques.name: Tool
subtechniques.descr: [APT33](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0064) has obtained and leveraged publicly-available tools for early intrusion activities.(Citation: FireEye APT33 Guardrail)(Citation: Symantec Elfin Mar 2019)

subtechniques.name: LSASS Memory
subtechniques.descr: [APT33](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0064) has used a variety of publicly available tools like [LaZagne](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0349), [Mimikatz](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0002), and ProcDump to dump credentials.(Citation: Symantec Elfin Mar 2019)(Citation: FireEye APT33 Guardrail)

subtechniques.name: LSA Secrets
subtechniques.descr: [APT33](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0064) has used a variety of publicly available tools like [LaZagne](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0349) to gather credentials.(Citation: Symantec Elfin Mar 2019)(Citation: FireEye APT33 Guardrail)

subtechniques.name: Cached Domain Credentials
subtechniques.descr: [APT33](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0064) has used a variety of publicly available tools like [LaZagne](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0349) to gather credentials.(Citation: Symantec Elfin Mar 2019)(Citation: FireEye APT33 Guardrail)

subtechniques.name: Spearphishing Attachment
subtechniques.descr: [APT33](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0064) has sent spearphishing e-mails with archive attachments.(Citation: Microsoft Holmium June 2020)

subtechniques.name: Spearphishing Link
subtechniques.descr: [APT33](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0064) has sent spearphishing emails containing links to .hta files.(Citation: FireEye APT33 Sept 2017)(Citation: Symantec Elfin Mar 2019)

subtechniques.name: Scheduled Task
subtechniques.descr: [APT33](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0064) has created a scheduled task to execute a .vbe file multiple times a day.(Citation: Symantec Elfin Mar 2019)

technique_table_data.name: Screen Capture
technique_table_data.descr: [APT33](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0064) utilize backdoors capable of capturing screenshots once installed on a system. (Citation: Jacqueline O'Leary et al. September 2017)(Citation: Junnosuke Yagi March 2017)

technique_table_data.name: Scripting
technique_table_data.descr: [APT33](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0064) utilized PowerShell scripts to establish command and control and install files for execution. (Citation: Symantec March 2019) (Citation: Dragos)

technique_table_data.name: Spearphishing Attachment
technique_table_data.descr: [APT33](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0064) sent spear phishing emails containing links to HTML application files, which were embedded with malicious code. (Citation: Jacqueline O'Leary et al. September 2017) [APT33](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0064) has conducted targeted spear phishing campaigns against U.S. government agencies and private sector companies. (Citation: Andy Greenburg June 2019)

subtechniques.name: Credentials In Files
subtechniques.descr: [APT33](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0064) has used a variety of publicly available tools like [LaZagne](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0349) to gather credentials.(Citation: Symantec Elfin Mar 2019)(Citation: FireEye APT33 Guardrail)

subtechniques.name: Group Policy Preferences
subtechniques.descr: [APT33](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0064) has used a variety of publicly available tools like Gpppassword to gather credentials.(Citation: Symantec Elfin Mar 2019)(Citation: FireEye APT33 Guardrail)

subtechniques.name: Malicious Link
subtechniques.descr: [APT33](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0064) has lured users to click links to malicious HTML applications delivered via spearphishing emails.(Citation: FireEye APT33 Sept 2017)(Citation: Symantec Elfin Mar 2019)

subtechniques.name: Malicious File
subtechniques.descr: [APT33](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0064) has used malicious e-mail attachments to lure victims into executing malware.(Citation: Microsoft Holmium June 2020)

technique_table_data.name: Valid Accounts
technique_table_data.descr: [APT33](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0064) has used valid accounts for initial access and privilege escalation.(Citation: FireEye APT33 Webinar Sept 2017)(Citation: FireEye APT33 Guardrail)

subtechniques.name: Cloud Accounts
subtechniques.descr: [APT33](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0064) has used compromised Office 365 accounts in tandem with [Ruler](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0358) in an attempt to gain control of endpoints.(Citation: Microsoft Holmium June 2020)

software_data.name: DEADWOOD
software_data.descr: [DEADWOOD](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1134) was previously linked to [APT33](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0064) operations in 2019.(Citation: RecordedFuture IranianResponse 2020)

software_data.name: Empire
software_data.descr: (Citation: FireEye APT33 Guardrail)(Citation: Symantec Elfin Mar 2019)
